summary: oxidative stress is attributed to such pathological condition that further contributes to the initiation and progression of liver injury. the strong antioxidant power of Nicotinamide (NA), Vitamin B2 (VB2) and Vitamin C (VC) can ameliorate TAA-induced oxidative stress-mediated liver injury in the rats. alase (CAT) were significantly compromised in the hepatic samples. combination of the three vitamins was found more effective compared to each.
